Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis lid; interior: glazed black with two narrow reserved bands to centre of sherd between two bands in added red; edge of lid red; on top, reserved area to centre; outside, black-figure decoration consisting of two lions facing away from each other, that on left only preserved as a tail, that on left without foreparts, with red mane; incised spoked rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
'170' pencilled on outside and' IV99 170' in ink on interior; also 'IV"99"' on a broken surface.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 338, no. B403) (Incorrectly stated as pl.20.19)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 39, pl. XX, no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2102)
